definition: to be on call/to be on standby
to stay
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
emergency standby/to be on standby
on call/always available/ready at all times

sentences.english: Mechanic will proceed to the fire pumps rooms to stand by and await further instruction.
sentences.chinese: 機械工應在消防水泵房內待命，等候進一步的指令。

sentences.english: Please be at the airport as soon as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我在機場待命可能有後補位嗎？

sentences.english: Me hammer is always ready, lads.
sentences.chinese: 俺的戰錘隨時待命，夥計。

sentences.english: Report, Captain, all have alighted, waiting for your orders.
sentences.chinese: 報告船長，大家已經下船待命了。

sentences.english: The cruiser stood off the beaches, waiting for the orders.
sentences.chinese: 巡洋艦停泊在遠離海灘的地方待命。

sentences.english: Lazio are in command but we can still bounce back.
sentences.chinese: 拉齊奧整裝待命，但是我們依然能夠翻盤。

sentences.english: Two battalions assembled foot two-tier stand.
sentences.chinese: 二營爲二梯隊集結山腳待命。

sentences.english: Guests have access to a 24-hour butler and a Rolls-Royce on standby ($5,897; hongkong.peninsula.com ).
sentences.chinese: 有24小時隨時待命的男管家和勞斯萊斯供客人調遣。

sentences.english: We downgraded the military alert from emergency to standby.
sentences.chinese: 我們把軍事戒備從緊急狀態降至待命狀態。

sentences.english: Security forces have been put on standby incase of violence.
sentences.chinese: 安全部隊已處於待命狀態，以防出現暴力事件。

sentences.english: Fortunately, our on-call site reliability team found the problem quickly and reverted the file.
sentences.chinese: 幸運的是，待命組很快的發現了問題並還原了文件。

sentences.english: Regiment will generally have three or four gun batteries under command.
sentences.chinese: 一個團一般配備三或四排炮待命。

sentences.english: We were positioned on the edge of a woods south of Kalwarya.
sentences.chinese: 我們在卡爾沃亞南部的森林邊上待命。

sentences.english: Another patrol car was standing by in Nan-Ching Sugar Factory.
sentences.chinese: 南靖糖廠中待命的巡道車。

definition: on call/always available/ready at all times
to warn/to alert/to be on the alert/to stand guard/sentinel
to dispatch/to assign/a dispatch
to provide support/to come to the rescue
to wait for (orders, a decision, a judgment)
to reinforce
(man a post and) defend
to lay out a defense
(of troops) to depart for/to head for
to stay behind to take care of things
(of a security guard etc) to be on duty, keeping an eye on things/to keep watch
to monitor/to keep a close watch over/surveillance
to summon/to muster/to assemble
to ambush/to lie in wait for/to lie low/ambush
(of the people in a group) to get into position (idiom)/(athletics) On your mark!
to pull back (an army)/to retreat
